resources.string: \"Asking for help is the bravest move you can make.\"
After pressing the button, an alert will be sent to your friends in 10 seconds
- In case of any Medical Emergency
- Situation that might need immediate police attendance
- In case of, unjust or forced behaviour of individuals towards children
- In case of, massive Fire outbreak
- Provide immediate medical help to victims
- In case of a severe vehicle crash
- Provide immediate Medical help to people suffered from the crash
- If you feel unsafe or threatened
- In case of, intentional harm or violence
- Held by someone who may be in possession of weapons
How to use our App in case of,
- Press the SOS Button to send a Panic Message to your Emergency Contacts.
- Specify the type of Emergency, if possible.
Take some deep breaths to get calm
Take a few deep breaths or count to 10 to calm down. The calmer you are, the better prepared you will be to handle the situation.
If you can\'t get out of your car, or its not safe to try, keep your seatbelt fastened, turn on your hazard lights and then press SOS button. Wait for the help to arrive.
Check on everyone involved in the crash to see if they have any injuries. If the injury is minor, use First-Aid. If needed, call the Ambulance immediately.
If there are no injuries and your vehicle is driveable, make a reasonable effort to move the vehicle to a safe spot that is not blocking traffic (like the shoulder of a highway or a parking lot).
Ask to see the license of the other drivers involved in the crash. Also get their name, address, phone number, insurance company, insurance policy number, and license plate number.
How to use our App for,
- When feeling unsafe, press the SOS Button to send Panic Message.
- Share your Live Location with your friends.
If you\'re alone, or hiring a cab, beware of your surroundings. If things seem even a slight unsafe get out of that place immediately. Don\'t let your guard down.
When you sense something NOT OKAY, immediately send your location and message your friends/family. Don\'t ignore such alarms.
In case you are in a sticky situation or feel exposed to the attacker, make an effort to press the SOS button. Scream so that people nearby can sense something wrong and help you.
Carry a self-defense product, such as pepper spray or a stun gun. These non-lethal, inexpensive and small products can allow you to deter an attacker long enough for you to get away.
Don’t be afraid to use anything in your hand to defend yourself. Use keys, bottle even your purse to inflict damage to your attacker
Following are the most vulnerable areas to attack:
a. Use your knees to hit hard between the legs of the attacker.
b. Using your fingers to poke hard in the eyes.
c. Hitting front part of the neck on the Adams apple will leave him in a shock.
d. Punching in the stomach will leave the attacker breathless and unable to chase you.
e. Hitting hard in the chest area.
How to use our App in case of,
- Press the SOS Button to send a Panic Message to your Emergency Contacts.
Calm down, but act swiftly. Stay low in case of smoke or fumes and try to make your way out as soon as possible. Call the Helpline Numbers immediately, if possible.

Feel the doorknob or higher on the door with the back of your hand. If it feels hot, fire may be on the other side of the door, so keep it shut. Stuff clothing, towels, or newspapers in the door’s cracks to keep smoke out.
Immediately evacuate the place. Use the stairs –NEVER use elevators. Elevators are normally tied to a fire detection system and are not available to occupants once the alarm sounds.
If the alarm is not already activated, pull the fire alarm on your way out to make everyone aware. If there is no alarm to activate, yell “fire” as you leave.
Move quickly to an open area. Dial Helpline number, report the address and stay on the phone until the fire department arrives at the place.
How to use our App in case of,
- Press the SOS Button to send a Panic Message to your Emergency Contacts.
- Send your location to your friends/family.

If you\'re ever in a situation where someone tries to abduct you, do anything you can to avoid going with them. Try escaping, then run as fast as you can in the direction of the nearest people or building you see.
Start shouting right away, especially if you know there are people nearby. Try yelling something like, Help! or Call the police!. Press SOS Button to send your location to the registered contacts.
Fight in any way you\'re able, whether that\'s hitting, kicking, biting, or scratching. Use products such as pepper spray which can allow you to deter an attacker long enough to run away.

If at any point it becomes clear that your captors have gained the upper hand, be extremely observant about the things the attacker do. In absence of the attacker, find a way to communicate with other people.

It can be really hard not to panic, but you want to stay calm and focused to look for methods that can help you get free. Look for mobile phones, which can help you contact the Police and get yourself rescued.
How to use our App in case of,
- Press the SOS Button to notify your Emergency Contacts about the emergency.
First-aid kits help you handle the medical emergencies as quickly as possible. These kits offer basic and instant care for common medical injuries
Check for signs of external bleeding

Always check for the pulse of the victim/patient first. Once confirmed to be running, you must ideally check for signs of any external bleeding. If the injured person is bleeding profusely, then call for the emergency medical services immediately.
Check for any objects that may be blocking the patient’s airway. If the breathing has stopped, you may need to administer artificial respiration.
Provide basic First-Aid until an ambulance arrives. Remain calm and keep your patient relaxed in a sleeping position to reduce the chances of any further injury or damage.
Treat the victim/patient with basic trauma care within the first few hours of the incident. Try to distract the patient from the sufferings, also to keep them calm and strong
How to use our App in case of,
- Press the SOS Button to send a Panic Message to your friends/family.
- Share Location and give necessary details.

Panic and stress are the main reasons that make the situation worse during natural disasters. If you stay calm during an earthquake, you can find ways to help yourself and everyone involved stay safe.
If you’re indoors during an earthquake, stay indoors. Stand against a wall near the center of the building or crawl under heavy furniture like a desk or table.
If you’re outdoors, stay outdoors. Avoid power lines or anything that might fall, and stay away from buildings.
At the first sign of an earthquake, drop to the ground and get on your hands and knees. This technique can be performed inside or outside and helps reduce the risk of injury.

Cover your head and neck with one hand. If you’re indoors, crawl underneath a table or next to an interior wall away from windows to shelter in place. If you’re outdoors, stay on your knees and bend over to protect your vital organs. Hold on, until the trembling stops
Avoid Doorways, Windows, bookcases, tall furniture and light fixtures. You could be hurt by shattered glass or heavy objects. Avoid Elevators.
How to use our App in case of,
- Press the SOS Button to send a Panic Message to your contacts.
- If possible, look for safety measures.

If a flood is likely in your area, listen to the radio or television for information. Be aware that flash flooding can occur. If there is any possibility of a flash flood, move immediately to higher ground.
Depending on where you are, the impact and the warning time of flooding, go to a safe location. Call the helpline numbers immediately and find ways to help other people out.
Don\'t walk, swim or drive in flooded areas. Cars or other vehicles won’t protect you from floodwaters.Always follow warnings about flooded roads.Stay off of bridges over fast moving water.
If your vehicle is trapped in rapidly moving water, stay inside. If water is rising inside the vehicle, seek refuge on the roof.
If trapped in a building go to its highest level . Do not climb into a closed attic, you may become trapped by rising floodwater.
If you\'re trapped, stay calm and wait for the rescue team to arrive. Make the rescue team aware that you\'re trapped. Shout for help or give signals to let them know your location.
It\'s important to have a well-stocked first aid kit in your home so you can deal with minor accidents and injuries.
A first aid kit is your go to for reducing the severity of the injury and preventing infection.
Your first aid kit should be locked and kept in a cool, dry place out of the reach of children.
A basic first aid kit may contain:
Plasters in a variety of different sizes and shapes
Small, medium and large sterile gauze dressings
Triangular bandages and crêpe rolled bandages
Skin rash cream, such as hydrocortisone
Cream or spray to relieve insect bites and stings
In case of Emergency, press the SOS button. This will send a Panic Message to your registered contacts.

Specify the type of Emergency in which you\'re trapped by clicking on one of the following options (Women Safety, Accident, Fire) . This will help your friends and family get more concrete information.
Know more about how to react in various Emergency Situations through TIPS PAGE.
Get Quick Access to Helpline Numbers under HELPLINE PAGE.
Edit your Personal Info, Contact Numbers, Panic Message anytime under SETTINGS MENU.
We recommend you to always keep your GPS turned ON.
you\'re about to send emergency alerts

"I need help! 

 Please reach ASAP to the location below:
